subject: Re: Logging tests reports
msgSnippet: ... Have you looked at the junitreport capabilites in Ant? Here is an article on the IBM DeveloperWorks site that shows a use of Ant 1.3 (not the latest
messageBody:
--- In junit@y..., Luis Joaquim <ljoaquim@c...> wrote:
> Hello,
>
> I am just starting to "discover" JUnit, and I have a begginer's
> question:
>
> Doesn't JUnit keeps the log of executing tests in a file ?
>
> Like, how many tests passed, which one failed, ..., and so on?
>
> If yes, where ?
>
> Thanks in advance,
>
> Luis Joaquim

Have you looked at the junitreport capabilites in Ant?
Here is an article on the IBM DeveloperWorks site that shows
a use of Ant 1.3 (not the latest version) to create some
reports in an HTML email format.

http://www-106.ibm.com/developerworks/library/j-junitmail/index.html

Richard.
